info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:34PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Chesterfield, eastern Lunenburg, Nottoway, northwestern Dinwiddie and southern Amelia Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Nottoway to Spainville. Movement was north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, very heavy rain, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blackstone, Crewe, Victoria, Kenbridge, Mannboro, Amelia Courthouse, Nottoway, Burkeville, Wilsons, Fort Pickett, Scotts Fork, Chula, Spainville, North Wellville, Irby, Earls, Ammon, Murdocks, Forkland and Darvills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
